line_1: The dear sad image still retains;
Witness, thou mangled form, that earth retains,
line_2: Witness a murder'd lover's cold remains;

line_1: Since still your countenance its smile retains,
And it's first spiral Form retains.
line_2: Th' elastic Fibre mocks his Pains,

line_1: Nor memory of the past, nor present sense retains.
line_2: While Psyche, quite exhausted by her pains,

line_1: Nor memory of the past, nor present sense retains.
line_2: Now faint and speechless in his arms remains,
The balsam-juice in all her veins;

line_1: Its parent's warmth and spotless name retains;
line_2: Which now increas'd through wide Britannia's plains,

line_1: My mind a chearful Temper still retains,
line_2: Spite of my snowy Head and icy Veins:

line_1: And midst each varying blast its hue retains;
line_2: Unchang'd alone the mournful yew remains,

line_1: Nor genial warmth nor genial juice retains
line_2: Their roots to feed and fill their verdant veins;

line_1: But not a cloud its genuine tint retains.
line_2: A glowing blush o'er the whole ether reigns,

line_1: Its name, and hue, the scentless plant retains,
line_2: And winter lingers in its icy veins.
Two thirds of all the virtue that remains,

line_1: The fav'rite Glance: O! yet my Mind retains
line_2: That fond Beginning of my infant Pains.

line_1: Or fleeting Breath it's latest Pow'r retains;
line_2: For long as Blood informs these circling Veins;

line_1: His servant's mind the whole retains,
line_2: The mules skim o'er the distant plains.

line_1: At others, whilst the mind its force retains,
line_2: The body sinks with sickness and with pains:

line_1: No sense of life, no motion he retains,
line_2: But fix'd, a dreadful monument remains!
